title: Action
excerpt: The main thing you can do on your turn in combat. You can take one action per turn, choosing from options like Attack, Cast a Spell, Dash, Disengage, Dodge, Help, Hide, Ready, Search, or Use an Object.
markdown:
# Action

When you take your turn in combat, you can take one action. Your action can be one of the options presented below, an action you gained from your class or a special feature, or an action that you improvise.

## Common Actions

### Attack
Make one melee or ranged attack. Some features allow you to make more than one attack with this action.

### Cast a Spell
Cast a spell with a casting time of 1 action. See [[magic_action]] for details.

### Dash
Gain extra movement equal to your speed for the current turn.

### Disengage
Your movement doesn't provoke [[opportunity_attack|opportunity attacks]] for the rest of the turn.

### Dodge
Until the start of your next turn, attack rolls against you have [[disadvantage]], and you make Dexterity saving throws with [[advantage]].

### Help
You aid a friendly creature in completing a task, or you distract a foe, giving your ally [[advantage]] on their next attack roll against that foe.

### Hide
Make a Dexterity (Stealth) check in an attempt to hide.

### Ready
Prepare to take an action in response to a trigger you specify.

### Search
Make a Wisdom (Perception) or Intelligence (Investigation) check to find something.

### Use an Object
Interact with a second object (you can interact with one object for free).

## Related Actions

See also [[bonus_action]] for additional things you can do on your turn, and [[reaction]] for actions you can take outside your turn.
